Hero.title: MBio7, the bio-based panel with a negative carbon footprint.
Hero.description: MBio7 is a bio-based panel made from natural materials such as wood residues, plant fibers, bamboo, palm leaves, coconut husks, or many other bio-based products. It is designed to provide optimal thermal and acoustic insulation while being environmentally friendly.

q1.question: What is the MBio7 panel?
q1.answer: MBio7 is an innovative construction panel, made of more than 90% recycled wood. It is lightweight, modular, and designed for sustainable, cost-effective, and fast construction.

q2.question: What is the environmental performance of the panel?
q2.answer: Each panel has a negative carbon footprint of -7.66 kg CO₂-eq. A 120 m² house built with MBio7 helps avoid around 3 tons of CO₂.

q3.question: Is the panel resistant?
q3.answer: Yes. MBio7 is resistant to water, fire, termites, frost, and earthquakes. It is a thermosetting material that does not rot and is unaffected by humidity.

q4.question: Is it compliant with construction standards?
q4.answer: Yes. Constructions using MBio7 comply with the RE 2020 standard when combined with suitable insulation.

q5.question: How much does a panel weigh?
q5.answer: An MBio7 panel weighs around 9 kg, which makes it easy to transport and install.

q6.question: Can a complete house be built with this material?
q6.answer: Yes. For example, a 10 m² test house was built in 2017 in Sospel with 160 panels (≈ 1,450 kg). The panels assemble easily and allow projects of any size.

q7.question: What is the production capacity?
q7.answer: About 400 panels per day for now, as we are currently in an expansion phase.

q8.question: Who is MBio7 intended for?
q8.answer: The material is ideal for NGOs (emergency reconstruction), local authorities, and individuals seeking ecological, modular, and cost-effective housing.
